column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Flower colour is an important trait for ornamental species , as brightly coloured flowers are attractive to people .

#Text=Additionally , colour patterns and colour spots play an essential role in attracting pollinators to insect-pollinated flowers , helping to improve the fitness of seeds and gene flow within species .
#Text=The response of pollinators to flower color is closely related to plant development and vigour .
#Text=Pigments in the petals have been extensively studied in many species , whereas the most important pigments in flowers are flavonoids , carotenoids and alkaloids .
#Text=In recent decades , many studies have focused on the formation of petal colour in plants .
#Text=In particular , the synthesis and degradation of anthocyanins have been illustrated , yet the genetic mechanism of carotenoid metabolism remains unclear .
#Text=One of the reasons for this ambiguity is that carotenoids are a subgroup of isoprenoid compounds that contain over 1158 isoforms .
#Text=Moreover , the genetic regulatory and metabolic pathways of carotenoids are not unique to C40 and other carotenoid categories .
#Text=Nevertheless , the precursor for the synthesis of almost all carotenoids is isopentenyl diphosphate , an organic substance containing five carbon atoms .

#Text=Multistage precursors involve a set of catalytic enzymes ( including geranylgeranyl pyrophosphate ( GGPP ) synthase , phytoene synthase , phytoene desaturase ( PDS ) , zeta-carotene desaturase ( ZDS ) and carotenoid isomerase ( CRTISO ) , among others ; see
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) , that are ultimately converted to carotene .
#Text=In addition , some co-factors such as phytochromes , electron mediators and transcription factors also participate in the synthesis of carotenoids .
#Text=Plastid terminal oxidase ( PTOX ) is a terminal oxidase involved in chlororespiration .
#Text=The discovery of this gene took more than half a century .
#Text=Diner and Mauzerall first revealed the positive feedback of oxygen in the photooxidation system almost fifty years ago .
#Text=Interestingly , this discovery indicated that there is a novel oxygen-dependent electron transport chain ( ETC ) in chloroplasts .
#Text=Subsequently , in the 1980s , Bennoun proved that a photorespiration chain , which was similar to the respiratory ETC in mitochondria , also existed in the chloroplasts in plants .
#Text=In 1999 , the immutans mutant of Arabidopsis thaliana brought attention to the PTOX gene .

#Text=Green and white stripes on the leaves of immutans confused researchers because they were not caused by the loss of enzymes in the chlorophyll synthesis pathway ; the white sectors contained few carotenoids but accumulated phytoene .
#Text=The same pattern was also observed in the ghost mutant of tomato , with faded fruits , and further studies revealed that this abnormal phenotype was caused by the loss of PTOX gene function .

#Text=In contrast to other enzymes in the carotenoid metabolic pathway , PTOX did not directly accelerate the conversion of intermediate products but accepted the electrons from PDS and ZDS and then delivered them as soon as possible (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) .
#Text=Importantly , the absence of PTOX combined with the IMMUTANS and GHOST mutations almost impeded carotenoid accumulation .
#Text=Hence , PTOX is considered an indispensable cofactor in the synthesis of carotenoids .
#Text=As a cyanide-sensitive oxidase , PTOX was frequently used to compare with another ubiquinol oxidase AOX ( alternative oxidase ) .
#Text=PTOX and AOX sequences are fairly similar and also regarded as homologues in many other studies .
#Text=One of the reasons is that they are both SHAM ( Salicylhydroxamic acid ) sensitive .
#Text=Besides , the two subfamilies share the same domain of AOX ( PF01786 ) in the C-terminus including two “ ExxH ” iron-binding motifs and a E(x)6Y motif as described by Carol and Kuntz .
#Text=Although they are similar in sequence and domains , nevertheless , gene structure analysis would give us a viewpoint to distinguish these two proteins .
#Text=Additionally , PTOXs mainly exist in plastids , especially in chloroplast , while AOXs are merely found in the inner membrane of mitochondria in accordance with current reports .
#Text=L. tulipifera is well known as an ornamental tree species due to its brightly colored flowers , odd leaf shape and graceful tree form .
#Text=The tulip-like color and shape of the flowers give L. tulipifera another name : “ tulip tree ” .
#Text=As a result , Liriodendron is often used for courtyard greening and street embellishment .

#Text=In recent years , the disadvantages of other ornamental trees are increasingly exposed , i. e. , clouds of poplar and planetree catkins ; hence , the tulip tree has become incredibly popular in China .

#Text=L. tulipifera originated in North America and was introduced to China decades ago to improve the adaptability and wood yield of Liriodendron chinense , a related species native to southern China .
#Text=Studies of L. tulipifera have focused on its origin and evolution , the development of its flowers and nectaries and its interspecific breeding , among other topics in the past years .

#Text=Accordingly , attracted to the color and color patterns on the petals , specifically the orange band lying in the nectary area , Demuth also demonstrated that the main pigments of this area of L. tulipifera were carotenoids .
#Text=Even though the orange band is essential for aesthetic purposes and facilitating pollination , the genetic mechanism underlying the formation of this band remains unclear .
